content: Yes, the blending of magical realism and political unrest is a hallmark of Latin American literature, and Isabel Allende masterfully incorporates this element into her novel. The use of magical elements allows Allende to explore the socio-political issues that were prevalent in Chile during the time period in which the story takes place. By portraying the characters' struggles through a magical lens, Allende addresses issues of power, oppression, and revolution in a unique and captivating way. The magical elements, in this case, are not only used for their own sake but also serve as a tool for social commentary. This adds depth to the novel and makes it an affecting read.
